description: Erection of a 5-storey building comprising office (Use Class E(g)) floorspace at ground and first floor levels and 7 residential units above including provision of two disabled car parking spaces and cycle storage.
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Notwithstanding the provisions set out in Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), or in any provision equivalent to those Orders in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order, the use here permitted shall be used solely for within Use Class E (c), (e) and (g).</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure the amenity values of nearby residential occupiers are maintained and that the development appropriately re-provides employment floorspace in line with Hackney Local Plan 2033.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The commercial uses hereby permitted may only operate between 0700 hours and 2300 on any day.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that the commercial uses are operated in a satisfactory manner and does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.<span style="white-space:pre">	</span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">No new plumbing, pipes, soil stacks, flues, vents, grilles, security alarms or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building unless as otherwise shown on the drawings hereby approved.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the first occupation of the commercial floorspace, a marketing and further actions strategy for the uptake of the commercial premises (Use Class E) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy should include details as set out within paragraphs 1.11-1.12 of Appendix 1 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 and full details of a fit out.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The space shall be fitted out in full accordance with the details approved prior to the first occupation of the residential property hereby approved and will not be marketed otherwise than in accordance with the details approved unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. In the event that the approved fit out and marketing are unsuccessful in finding occupier/s the further actions will be undertaken in full, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that the employment floorspace hereby approved is of an adequate standard which meets local business need and is adequately marketed and provided to meet local business need.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">All residential premises shall be designed in accordance with BS 8233:2014 “Guidance on sound insulation and noise reduction for buildings” to attain the following internal noise levels:&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="white-space: pre; font-size: 14px;">	</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Good resting conditions: Living rooms 35 dB (day: T = 16 hours 07:00 – 23:00)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Good dining conditions: Dining areas 40dB (day: T = 16 hours 07:00 – 23:00)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Good sleeping conditions: Bedrooms 30 dB (night: T = 8 hours 23:00 – 07:00)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">LAmax 45 dB (night 23:00 – 07:00)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Before commencement of the use hereby permitted a test shall be carried out to show the standard of sound insulation required shall be met and the results submitted to the Environmental Protection Team for approval.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that the occupiers and users of the proposed development do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of excess environmental noise.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the first occupation of each building or part of a building or use, a ‘Secured by Design’ accreditation shall be obtained for such building or part of such building or use and thereafter all features are to be permanently retained.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: In the interest of creating safer, sustainable communities.</span></p>

<p>P<span style="font-size: 14px;">rior to the first occupation of the development details of the positions of inlets and vents associated with air conditioning or ventilation shall be submitted for approval by the local planning authority. The development shall thereafter be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of the development.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To mitigate future exposure to air pollution, to protect air quality, human health and to contribute towards National Air Quality Objectives.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">All non-CHP space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers must achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh. Evidence to demonstrate that all installed boilers meet this standard will be provided to the satisfaction of and approved in writing by the Planning Authority before occupation. Subject to written approval by the Planning Authority this condition may be discharged in agreed phases.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure the acceptability of the scheme with respect to NOx pollution.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, an Air Quality Neutral Assessment produced in line with the air quality neutral GLA guidance shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To protect air quality, human health and to contribute towards National Air Quality Objectives.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved, a suitably detailed Air Quality Assessment shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until the recommendations of the approved Air Quality Assessment have been implemented. The Air Quality Assessment shall address how the proposal will impact on local air quality and detail of measures to protect the internal air quality, including:&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. Identifying how the building works and related activities as well as the future operation and use of the development may impact upon local air quality.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b. Modelling the impact of the development on local air quality.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">c. Identifying mitigation measures that are already part of any planned development.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">d. Identifying possible additional mitigation measures that may be implemented to maintain and where possible improve air quality in the vicinity of the development.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">e. Providing full details of measures that will be implemented to maintain and where possible improve air quality in the vicinity of the development.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">f. Providing full details of measures that will be implemented to protect the internal air quality of buildings.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">g. Identifying measures that will be implemented or continue to be implemented after the completion of the development with clear timescales of when information will be provided.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To protect air quality and human health by ensuring that the production of air.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved, details of bird and bat box provision, including swift bricks, at or close to eaves level shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To provide potential habitat for local wildlife.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a Delivery, Waste and Servicing Management Plan, including details of times and quantity of deliveries to the premises, the frequency and type of vehicles proposed, and management of any external operations related to the premises shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, deliveries and servicing shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plan.<br></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: In order to ensure that delivery and servicing does not impact the amenity of neighbouring occupiers and the safe and efficient operation of the highway.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of the work, the applicant shall submit, and have approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, a detailed layout, cross sections (scale 1:20), full specifications and a detailed management and maintenance plan of the biodiverse roof with a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, not including the vegetative mat. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: In the interest of sustainable drainage.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of the work, a policy compliant cycle parking plan for the provision of 17 residential cycle parking spaces (3 of which are to be short stay spaces) and 9 commercial cycle parking spaces (2 of which are to be visitor spaces) is required, which includes:</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. Details of layout, foundation, stand type and spacing.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b. A minimum of 5% of long stay spaces should be for adapted/larger bikes.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">If two tier racks are proposed they must have a mechanical or pneumatically assisted system for accessing the upper level. The storage spaces and stands must be kept in good working condition, in accordance with the above details, in perpetuity.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for the safe and secure storage of bicycles is made for future occupiers and in the interest of improving highway conditions in general.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to the commencement of work for each section of the development or stage in the development, as may be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority (LPA), a scheme including the following components to address the risk associated with site contamination shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the LPA.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. A site investigation scheme (Phase 2) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those off site;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b. The results of the investigation and detailed risk assessment referred to in (a) and, based on these, in the event that remediation measures are identified necessary, a remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">c. A verification plan providing details of the data that will be collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in the remediation strategy in (b) are complete and identifying requirements for the longer monitoring of pollution linkages, maintenance and arrangements for contingency action.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Any investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in strict accordance with the requirements of the Environment Agency’s Land Contamination Risk Management (LCRM ). If additional significant contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development, it must be reported in writing immediately to the LPA.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">For the avoidance of doubt, this condition can be discharged on a section by section basis.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure the risks from land contamination to the future users of the land and neighbouring land are minimised, together with those to controlled waters, property and ecological systems, and to ensure that the development can be carried out safely without unacceptable risks to workers, neighbours and other offsite receptors.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">No development shall take place until a detailed a Construction Management Plan covering the matters set out below has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. A construction method statement covering all phases of the development to include details of noise control measures and measures to preserve air quality (including a risk assessment of the construction phase);</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b. A construction waste management plan setting out how resources will be managed and waste controlled at all stages during a construction project, including, but not limited to, details of dust mitigation measures during construction works, the location of any mobile plant machinery, details of measures to be employed to mitigate against noise and vibration arising out of the construction process demonstrating best practical means;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">c. A construction traffic management plan to include the following: the construction programme/timescales; the number/frequency and size of construction vehicles; construction traffic route and trip generation; location of deliveries; pedestrian and vehicular access arrangements; any temporary road/footway closures during the construction period; details of parking suspensions (if required) and the duration of construction;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">d. A dust management plan to include details of how dust from construction activity will be monitored, controlled and mitigated against following best practice guidance. This should include monitoring of particulate matter at the application site boundary in the direction of sensitive receptors following the SPG Mayor of London Control of Dust and Emissions Guidance.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity. To protect air quality and people’s health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a minimum during the course of building works.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to commencement of above ground works of the development hereby approved, the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. Material samples of all externally appearing features;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b. Provision of a detailed materials sheet showing the location of materials, their manufacturer and product reference and precedent photographs;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">c. The submitted details shall include bricks, and not brick slips.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the details thereby approved.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure a high standard of design.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">Prior to commencement of above ground works of the development hereby approved, the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">a. Detailed drawings of typical windows, doors and facade sections (All at scale 1:5, 1:10 and 1:20);</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">b.&nbsp;</span>Full details of brickwork bond specifications, and proposed locations on externally facing elevations;</p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">c. Full Details of ground floor commercial shop front design.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">d. Details of screening to the rear balconies.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The development shall be carried out in full compliance with the details thereby approved.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;"><br></span></p><p><span style="font-size: 14px;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area and to ensure an acceptable standard of accommodation for future occupants.</span></p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
